answers.answer: Chest pain can be a sign of a serious heart condition and should be dealt with accordingly.  However, depending on your profile (age, sex, diabetes, cholesterol, smoking, family history, high blood pressure), the type of chest pain (pressure, burning, cramping, stinging) and its character (sharp, dull, diffuse, focal, etc), this may or may not be heart related.  I would need to know that info to get a better idea of what's going on.  At the same time, given that time is of essence with cardiac chest pain, if you are having chest pain right now, or very frequently throughout the day, you should seek medical attention right away.

question: i have chest pain for sometimes 10 to 20 minutes and pain in my right arm, my blood pressure  has been high and i don't know what to do i have no insurance.
title: chest pain
